lessons.title: Vector operations
objectives: Add, scale, and interpret vectors geometrically

cards.front: What is a vector in R^n?
cards.back: An ordered n-tuple of real numbers (x₁, x₂, ..., xₙ), which can represent a point or a directed arrow from the origin.

cards.front: What is the geometric meaning of the dot product?
cards.back:
It relates to lengths and the cosine of the angle between vectors: a·b = ||a|| ||b|| cos(θ).

If a·b = 0, the vectors are orthogonal (perpendicular).

cards.front: How do you compute the length (norm) of a vector v = (v₁, v₂, ..., vₙ)?
cards.back:
||v|| = √(v₁² + v₂² + ... + vₙ²)

This is the Euclidean norm, derived from the dot product: ||v|| = √(v·v)
